fulltext:
VO VINH PHUOC 
Address: 452 Nguyen Thai Son Street, Go Vap district 
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam 
Date of Birth: Feb 26, 1983 
Sex: Male 
Cell: (+84) 909 869 279 
Email: vinhphuocvo2179@gmail.com 
SUMMARY 
8+ years of experience in software testing of desktop, web and mobile applications. Expertise in manual testing in term 
of designing test plans, test cases, test approaches to reach the highest test efficiently in a suitable time and familiar 
with different testing techniques and test types. Strength in automation testing via TestArchitect tool, able to design the 
good frameworks to adapt the application’s changes. Fimiliar with many SDLC models, especially Agile. 
Experience in effective communication, team work and customer service. Working hard, self-motivation and self-
esteem. 
TECHNICAL SKILLS 
Fundamental Software Testing Skills: 
 
Familiar with different levels of testing (component, iteration, system and acceptant testing); functional as 
well as non-functional test (performance test, load test, stress test, security test..) 
 
Familiar with many test design methodologies such as Action Based Testing (Advanced), top down, bottom up 
 
Experience in quality controls via different artifacts such as quantity and quality of bugs/test cases, 
development/testing progress, reports… 
 
Good at creating test plans, test strategies, test cases and testing reports 
 
Experience in bug reports and bug life cycle management 
Manual Testing Skills: 
 
Test requirement analyzing (8+ year) 
 
Test case design/execute/maintain and ad-hoc testing (8+ year) 
 
Test plan development (5+ year) 
Automation Testing Skills 
 
Automation tools: TestArchitect (6+ years), Selenium (basic), TestComplete (basic), QTP (basic) 
 
Good at capturing interfaces, implementing actions, using settings and configuration 
 
Experience in running regression, debugging and maintaining scripts efficiently 
Other skills 
 
Able to use many tests management tools: QC (3 years), Zephyr (2+ year), MTM (2+ years), Jira (3+ years), TFS 
(3+ year) 
 
CI/CD: TFS (2+ year), Jenkin (2+ year) 
 
Experience in software development process: Agile – Scrum (5+ year) 
 
OS: Windows, Linux, MAC 
 
Scripting languages: C#, Java, VB script, Java Script 
 
Databases: SQL, MySQL 
SOFT SKILLS 
Communication skill 
 
Efficiently communicate with teams and clients 
 
Experience in many kinds of reports such as daily reports, end-sprint report, final testing reports 
 
Experience in supporting clients and troubleshoot issues. 
 
Escalate issues in time and follow till they’re done 
 
Able to do presentations to transfer knowledge 
Leadership skills 
 
Strength at problem-solving including technical, processes or human issues 
 
Experience in influent and motivating members by building the good relationship, setting the clear short-term, 
long-term goals 
KEY CLIENTS 
Websense, Halliburton, Ascom, EA, Elekta, IBI, General Mills and TestAchitect product 
EMPLOYMENT HISTORY 
LogiGear Corporation, Ho Chi Minh                                                                                                                
  2008 - Present 
 
Test Architect project – Develop automation testing tool (May 2016 – present) 
o 
Project features: Implement new features for design, manage test cases and test results as well as 
enhance automation capability to work with new platforms and browsers. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Sr.Tester and Test Lead 
Create and execute test plans; review test results and create test reports (end sprints, end releases) 
Create, implement, execute and maintain test cases to verify all TestArchitect features. 
Review and handle difficult tasks in team. Support and train to team members 
Support clients directly via email, support portal and Skype when they have any problems with 
TestArchitect. 
o 
Technical Environment: TFS, Jira, Zephyr, Jenkin, QC, API, WebDriver. 
 
Halliburton project – Support new APIs to work with datasets, actions and test suites in TA (Mar 2016 – 
Apr 2016) 
o 
Project features: Halliburton need to get/set/check datasets, actions and test suites via command-
line or third-party application. This project is to support the APIs to resolve this request. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Sr.Tester and Test Lead. 
Working with PO, SM, Stakeholders to define the project scope as well as testing scope. Providing the 
estimation of testing and project schedule. Creating the test plan including all artifacts impacted to 
product quality such as testing scope, feature to be/not to be tested, impacted areas, testing 
approach, testing schedule and risks. Reviewing test designs and supporting team members to resolve 
the impediments. Contribution in increase the automation coverage to 90% of test cases designed. 
Creating the reports after each sprint, testing phase. The owner of release management. 
o Technical Environment: TA, C# harness, Python harness, Jira. 
 
Elekta project – TA-QC integration enhancement (Jun 2015 – Dec 2015) 
o 
Project features: ELEKTA is using TA as automation tool and QC as test manager tool. This project is 
to support some major enhancement requirements as below 
- 
Allow or block uploading tests from TA to QC based on Approval status and Revision 
Timestamp 
- 
Allow or block importing tests from QC to TA based on Approval status and Revision 
Timestamp 
- 
Allow or block uploading results from TA to QC based on Approval status and Revision 
Timestamp 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Sr.Tester. 
 
Join the meetings with clients to get requirements and feedback 
 
Creating the test plan including all artifacts impacted to product quality such as testing scope, 
feature to be/not to be tested, impacted areas, testing approach, testing schedule and risks. 
 
Create and review the test case design, implementation and executation. 
 
Creating the reports after each sprint, testing phase. 
 
Do the demo to clients. 
 
Support clients to troubleshoot issues via email and GoToMeeting. 
o Technical Environment: TA, QC, Python harness, SVN, Jira 
IBI project – Support new APIs to import/export TestArchitect items (May 2015 – Jun 2015) 
o 
Project features: IBI needs to import/export TA items such as test modules, actions, interfaces… 
through command-line or third-party application, instead of TA Application. This project is to 
implement new APIs to support this request. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Sr.Tester and Test Lead. 
Working with PO, SM, Stakeholders to define the project scope as well as testing scope. Providing the 
estimation of testing and project schedule.  Creating the test plan including all artifacts impacted to 
product quality such as testing scope, feature to be/not to be tested, impacted areas, testing 
approach, testing schedule and risks. Reviewing test designs and supporting team members to resolve 
the impediments. The owner of release management. 
o Technical Environment: TA, Python harness, SVN, Jira 
Halliburton – TA-MTM integration (Jun 2014 – May 2015) 
o 
Project features: Halliburton is using TA as automation tool and MTM as test manager tool. Therefore, 
they need to exchange tests and results between TA and MTM. They also need to run test by TA in 
attended and un-attended mode on MTM. Here are the key features of project 
- 
Mapping TA project with MTM project and doing the authorization 
- 
Uploading and importing tests between TA and MTM 
- 
Uploading results from TA to MTM 
- 
Association and create test methods on VS to call TA test cases on MTM 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Sr.Tester and Test Lead. 
Creating the test plan including all artifacts impacted to product quality such as testing scope, feature 
to be/not to be tested, impacted areas, testing approach, testing schedule and risks. Reviewing test 
designs and supporting team members to resolve the impediments. Monitor the testing results, 
progress to make sure that project is on-track with good quality. Conducting and reviewing documents 
including user guides, installation guides and release notes. 
o 
Technical Environment: TA, Visual Studio 2013 and 2015, MTM, TFS, Jira. 
Halliburton – Automation support (Mar 2013 – July 2015) 
o 
Project features: Halliburton is using TA tool to automate all their test cases. Applications of 
Halliburton using many different kinds of platforms (Java,.NET, Silverlight, Citrix, Window, Linux…) 
with a lot of customize controls. This project is to provide the specific TA builds, actions, harness 
actions that help service team implement all Halliburton test cases. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Project Lead and Sr.Tester 
At the first time starting this project, working as Sr.Tester. Design/implement/execute test cases. Run 
regression. Then, transfer testing stuff to another tester and doing the management stuff. Working 
with service team on the delivery processes. Defining the working scope for each release. Conducting 
and reviewing documents including user guides, installation guides and release notes. 
o 
Technical Environment: TA, Java,.NET, Sliverlight, Python, Window 7/8, Linux. 
Websense – TA – QC integration (Sep 2012 – Jan 2014) 
 
 
 
 
o 
Project features: Websense uses TA to automate their test cases. Their testing environment is Firefox 
on Linux RHEL 6.3/6.4. Before using TA, Websense manages their test cases by QC. The main purpose 
of this project is to support Websense using TA to run all their test cases and synchronize tests/results 
between TA and QC 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Involved as Project Lead and Sr. Tester 
Communication with PO, stakeholder to make clear all requirements, issues. Reproduce all issues 
reported by Websense. Support Websense directly in term of using TA, debugging scripts. Verify TA 
builds, patches before delivering to Websense. Review tasks of team members and send the reports. 
o 
Technical Environment: TA, QC, Python, Java, Firefox, Linux. 
 
TA – Automation on Android (Nov 2011 – Aug 2012) 
o 
Project features: Develop TA Automation tool to work on Android Mobile. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Senior Tester 
Create/implement/executing/maintaining test cases to verify all TA actions, setting. Create and 
configure Android Emulator and real mobiles for testing. Review test cases, test scripts of other team 
members. Support lead to do the reports. 
o 
Technical Environment: TA, Java, Android SDK, Android 3.2/3.3/4.0/4.1. 
 
TA – Automation (Aug 2011 – Nov 2011) 
o 
Project features: Develop TA Automation on different platforms. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Senior Tester 
Build scripts for testing TA Automation (actions and settings) on different platforms effectively. Assign 
tasks to team members. Review tasks and send reports to test lead. 
o 
Technical Environment: TA, Java, .NET 4.0/4.5, Win32, IE7/8/9, Firefox, Chrome, Lunix. 
 
EA – Pogo (Apr 2011 – Aug 2011) 
o 
Project features: Pogo.com is a free online gaming website that offers over 100 casual games. This 
project is about finding bugs of games and verify features on this website. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Senior Tester 
- 
Daily meeting with clients and internal team 
- 
Do the ad-hoc testing 
- 
Post and verify bugs 
o 
Technical Environment: Testing techniques, Jira. 
 
Ascom (Jan 2008 – May 2010) 
o 
Project features: Ascom is a telecommunications company. They buy the testing service of LogiGear 
for testing their applications and automate test cases as well. 
o 
Personal Responsibilities/Contribution: Tester 
Research to configure testing environment including configure probes to simulate different devices. 
Communicate with client directly on technical issues. 
Design, implement, execute and maintain test cases. Run regression in each release. 
o 
Technical Environment: TA, Java, IE. 
EDUCATION AND TRAINING 
Education: 
 
Go Vap High school (HCM, Vietnam)                    From 09/1999 – 09/2001 
 
Associate degree  at FPT-Aptech College (HCM, Vietnam)            From 08/2005 – 06/2007 
 
Academic English at Swinburne University (Melburne, Australia) From 05/2010 – 02/2011 
FOREIGN LANGUAGE:  
English: Advanced. Able to communicate fluently in verbal and written.
